text:
Hello,

Is there an away to fetch the history of associations for a custom object?

Hi there ! Recently, every transactional email I send is notified as HARD BOUNCED even though the email reaches the destination
Anyone having a clue on what's happening here ?

Hey There! :wave:

I am using the `CRM Extension`  card on the `DEAL` record type and *want to know:*
• How to know which `company/contact` is *linked* to this deal?
I only see deal properties that have no linkage to contacts/companies, so how can we know to which contact/company the deal is linked using the `fetch request` ?

Thanks a lot dev community :pray: :party_stub:

hello All,

I am new to api´s and trying to learn how it works with HubSpot while pulling data from HubSpot to GCP. We have a custom api created and exposed via wso2 and i would like to provide api endpoints for particular pages like deals or goals under crm.

My question here is, the url is going to be generic ? and since my request will be via a private app it´ll login to my instance and get that page or every HubSpot account will have a different endpoint url to be given with HubSpot instance id ?
how are you sending them?
you have your spf records and other email sending stuff set up, dkim keys?  i’m not sure that would be an issue, just mentioning
I do, yes
Just to mention, this problem popped around 5 days ago, no configuration changed since then, dns and code wise
yeah, i’m not sure at all. you can see it delivered. have you talked to support at all?

if it is an api that has cors restrictions, then you have to satisfy the cors

it isn’t impossible, but if you say what i recommend is too much, the attempts at working around would be more difficult if they are possible

Yes and I tried with my own address, I get the email no problems.
Last time i talked to official support, the support guy said he can't handle "technical problems" and to check with the HubSpot developers Slack, I figured i'd have the same answer with this one.
I'll try anyway
Thanks !

i’m not sure how it works with api questions but when i recap out to support i give out a massive amount of information and ask if it is a bug. i have dates times, things that changed that didn’t change. 

i spend quite a bit of time so the person sees i’ve taken the time to document what is wrong what is right, testing different ways, etc
and then i ask if they can move this up to development as it seems like a big g in the behavior
have you tried doing this from a developer account?
i’m asking that because if you could prove it works in other portals or is the same in other portals, using same code different app keys that might be worth setting up in email
anyone experiencing 500 errors?
Yeah also haven’t had any problems with postman to test out and then use axios code :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello everyone,

I did a chatbot on my website with HubSpot.
I linked my account with my google ads. But now i checked my google ads and observe that the leads are not connected with my google ads so finally my campaings from my google ads are loosing interest.

I checked on few forums and there is a script to connect google tag manager with my google ads and HubSpot but i do not understand how to do it?

Can someone help me to understand the steps i have to do to connect both ?

i'm not a pro of google tag manager, thanks for all!

Good morning, Goal: Will setting up Webhooks with the end goal to notify my affiliate referral partner when there is an update to  contact (i.e. status change to 'new client'allow my affiliate referral partner any more access then they already have with the access token? crm.objects.contacts.write
Are the APIs down?
<https://status.HubSpot.com/>
yes
wow zero
hahaha, what isn't down right now?
Lol
I think it's localized to the north east and mid west
No interruptions over here

The access token allows you to access the Web hook and create Web hooks around that. Sending the notification to the user would not affect their access, if they have access to view the record in HubSpot they can view it
<@U04JUUACH6E> you are amazing, may god or a gang of goth girls bless you

they only have scope: crm.objects.contacts.write
would that scope allow  them to view the record? I was under the impression they needed the 'read' scope enabled in order to view contacts, or can they view with only the WRITE scope open? I did not want to open the READ scope up because I don't want them to be able to pull all my contacts, I only want them to be able to import THEIR leads as they opt in, and to be able to see a status update on a lead i.e. when they become a client.
That's probably the funniest thank you line I've ever heard
Ever

*the scope of your your api calls. full stop*

the notification you create for them will have whatever details in it to your user 

what they have access to inside HubSpot is determined by their HubSpot user permissions

well currently the way we're operating is with the 'private app/access token/api to import the opt ins
they haven't been made a HubSpot user, is that what you're referring to?
here is a shot of the private app/logs

any idea why the very first api call shows as 'get contact list' 403GET`/contactslistseg/v1/lists/all/contacts/all`
Does this mean they tried to steal my contact list or could this be an error? I questioned my affiliate as to why this was the first api call made and they just acted like they did not try to steal my contacts but instead he was just trying to make a call to establish connection, but I'm like "Well it shows you tried to get all contacts, and if I had the READ scope enabled as you requested, you would have gotten my contact list", he just acted like that wasn't what he was trying to do, but it seems pretty clear that the request URL shows 'get contact list', so am I right in assuming this was an attempt to steal my list?

by the way, I am looking to bring on a dev team in the very very near future as I launch and scale so if this communication keeps up, consider yourself at the front of that potential list of dev teams. You're in FL? Im just north of Tampa.

Is there a way to create Lists via the API?

My goal is to create lists automatically in HubSpot when a Zoom Webinar occurs
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/lists>

cape coral here. i am headed out of town in a little bit 

i think im confused on everything that is going on. would it make sense to have a call on tuesday next week to review some of this and see how i can point you in the right direction? apologies that i can’t dig into this right now, might have some down time but im trying to get out the door and get in the road
glad to help out in any way to get you moving i. the right direction but i just have a time crunch and am having trouble because of the trip
understood

any idea why the very first api call from my affiliate that im setting up shows as 'get contact list'?

they were only to be importing leads not getting my contact list...

thats the meat of what I was asking, trying to understand why they would make that api call, unless they were indeed trying to get my contact list?

403GET`/contactslistseg/v1/lists/all/contacts/all`
so maybe i misunderstood. you gave your key out to a partner? and they are making the calls?

what is your intent with sharing the key with these partners? os it so they can read data or write data?

if you want them to write data, like them creating a contact, it would be wise to create a form with the properties you want them to be able to write to and to tell them to use the forms api to submit. 

this would create contacts in your HubSpot
if i’m still off here maybe you can explain a bit on the overall system you are trying to set up
you could also create a workflow for people that have that contact property and add them to a list

hey all, is anyone familiar with how someone can retrieve the current remaining 10 secondly HubSpot api limit? I basically want to check how much api call limit is remaining before running an api heavy task so i can either slow down the task or put a bit of a delay before starting the task it self (if some % of the api limit has already been reached).

ive seen api calls that can get the current daily limit, but not much documentation around the 10 second limit.
Some calls let you check the limits in the response header

I'm from Mperativ. We are very excited about the List API. We are already using the Export API to sync HubSpot CRM data to the Mperativ platform. With regards to the List API, is there a way to not only retrieve the list membership, but also the date the member was added to the list? Also, if a dynamic list is associated to a campaign, can we pull the campaign name too. Based on documentation, it doesn't look like we can do this, but thought I'd ask in the hopes that there are undocumented features. :slightly_smiling_face: (edite
yep yep, the response header is the way to go

sadly 2 issues with that:
1. unfortunatly it doesnt seem like the response header is exposed if you use the nodejs HubSpot api (the npm library). Does anyone know if there is a way to expose that at all while using the library?
2. according to the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/usage-details|docs here>, `X-HubSpot-RateLimit-Secondly` and `X-HubSpot-RateLimit-Secondly-Remaining` are both considered deprecated.
